comment: Idiot ruined head by being too sensitive

Get ready to read. Midterm/Final count HEAVILY. The good news is that you won't bomb either if you do everything in the modules. She's ok. It was an online course and aside from her enthusiastic posts on what's due that week, didn't really hear from her. She drops a lot of stuff at the end which is nice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She was very nice and explained everything very well. The textbook was mandatory because it had an online portal where she assigned the homework. Homework is very easy. Your grade is based on a few tests, homework and periodically a few extra credit opportunities. Attendance became mandatory when students failed to show up, but not needed to pass.

There is no point of going to class, but since she will kill your grade if you don't, you have to. Spends most of class time blabbering about her life and does not teach actual information in which we need to do well on tests. If you take her, be prepared to learn everything from the textbook. Waste of time going to her class.

Professor Parton is really nice but sometimes she can have an attitude for no reason. Her lectures are interesting but you never feel like they prepare you for the tests. There are 4 tests, one being the final, all pretty difficult. If you miss more than three classes your grade suffers. Overall, she makes the class way harder than it needs to be.

Professor Parton is a great professor who is very passionate about communications and human behaviors. She uses her own life situations to but the textbook into a clearer perspective. The class is definitely an "easy a" if you come to class and review the powerpoints.

This is an awesome teacher! Super easy class, just study the notes for the test and you will pass for sure. One presentation all semester, which she grades very easily. Attendance is mandatory but it is for all human communication classes. Very interesting to listen to! Would definitely recommend taking.

She goes on and on about her family and doesn't relate to the topic. Test are hard, but all online in class. She makes you do one presentation in front of the class with a group which has nothing to do with the class. You don't have to know any of the presentations for the test. She makes you buy the textbook and workbook but only use workbook 3x.

She is a very sweet teacher, and the class is pretty fun, but I cant tell you how many times ive sent an email with no reply,and still to this point no reply. Also she not very clear on her group project,she didn't give specifics, I felt like I had to go on a treasure hunt for the information which is very frustrating.

Dr. Parton is that sweet, southern teacher you've always wanted. She's nice, compassionate towards her job, and she always walks in with a smile on her face no matter how bad her morning was. Her lectures are fairly long, but she makes jokes and gets laughs. One group presentation and three tests, that's it. I'd definitively take her class again.

Great teacher. She is really funny, and always talks about her kids and husband, but they're great stories. Also talks about her life a lot. For an 8 AM class, she kept me very awake. Study the PowerPoints she puts online when a test is coming up. If you do that, you should have no problem passing the class. Tough grader on the individual project.

She talks a whole lot. She often tells personable stories to help students grasp concepts. Tests can be tough, but if you go over her power points a few times the night before a test you shouldn't make less than a B. One major speech assignment which is 20% of your grade, she grades more harshly than expected, most people get high B's. Nice lady.

Probably my favorite professor so far at KSU. Very interesting and funny, although she mentions her religious views often which probably bothers some people. Not great with technology, but it's entertaining. Posts powerpoints from class and study guides for tests. Tests are kinda tough.. even when you cheat. Barely used the textbook. I'd recommend.
